questions.question: …………………. fast, I managed to catch up with him.
He is …………………… loyal to cheat on her.
questions.description: This sentence means the same as 'He is so loyal that he will not / cannot cheat on her.'

questions.question: ………………….. the doctors tried their best, they could not save the patient.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction connecting two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: James, ………………………. works abroad, is coming home next week.
questions.description: That cannot be used to refer people in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: ………………… their best efforts, they could not save him.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition use it before a noun or ing form.

questions.question: The higher you go, ………………………… it gets.
They fought to the finish …………………………, they could not win.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb it does not connect two clauses.

questions.question: If the manager finds out, we ………………………… in trouble.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I would rather you ………………….. me alone.
questions.description: After would rather, we use a simple past with present or future meaning.

questions.question: You had better not …………………. him up.
questions.description: Use the bare infinitive after had better.

questions.question: It is time she ……………………… her mistake.
questions.description: Use a simple past after it is time.
